name: Alon–Saks–Seymour conjecture
summary:
In graph theory, the Graham–Pollak theorem states that the edges of an

-vertex complete graph cannot be partitioned into fewer than

        −
        1

 complete bipartite graphs. It was first published by Ronald Graham and Henry O. Pollak in two papers in 1971 and 1972 (crediting Hans Witsenhausen for a key lemma), in connection with an application to telephone switchi
